text:
- I was in the military and I
can remember in basic training

looking around and being able
to pick out the kids around me
who had been part of a team

and who had worked for
something bigger than themselves
and who had to understand teamwork

and who weren't just
focused on their own goals.

So sports to me is just such
an important way for kids
to start to develop character.
We're all dads of travel sports kids,

and so we've been around the
Northwest to different venues

and cities, and we just
kept asking ourselves,

"Why can't we have
something like this here?"
We asked the city of Hermiston,
"We've got this great property out there.

Can we convert that
into a sports complex?"
The city agreed, we got the green light,
and that's when we really started trying
to build this thing.

I've never lived in a community
where people were so willing
to help out.
Amazon Web Services, they led the charge
and donated $300,000
so that we could get lights put in place.

They're out there practicing
under those lights right now.
It's truly been amazing.
